title: Introduction to Area of Rectangles and Squares
content:
The area of a shape is the amount of space it covers on a flat surface. For rectangles and squares, the area is calculated by multiplying the length by the width. 

&&img&& https://example.com/area_rectangle.png &&img&&
speech_to_text_content: The area of a shape is the amount of space it covers on a flat surface. For rectangles and squares, the area is calculated by multiplying the length by the width.

title: What is Area?
content:
Area measures the surface inside a shape. It is expressed in square units such as square centimetres (cm²) or square metres (m²). 

Remember: area = length × width.

&&img&& https://example.com/area_units.png &&img&&
speech_to_text_content: Area measures the surface inside a shape. It is expressed in square units such as square centimetres or square metres. Remember, area equals length multiplied by width.
explanation: Area is always measured in square units because it covers two dimensions.

title: Calculating Area of a Rectangle
content:
To find the area of a rectangle, multiply its length by its width.

Example: A rectangle with length 8 cm and width 5 cm has an area of 8 × 5 = 40 cm².

&&img&& https://example.com/rectangle_area_example.png &&img&&
speech_to_text_content: To find the area of a rectangle, multiply its length by its width. For example, a rectangle with length eight centimetres and width five centimetres has an area of forty square centimetres.
explanation: Multiplying length and width gives the number of square units inside the rectangle.

title: Calculating Area of a Square
content:
Since all sides of a square are equal, its area is found by squaring one side.

Example: A square with side length 6 cm has an area of 6 × 6 = 36 cm².

&&img&& https://example.com/square_area_example.png &&img&&
speech_to_text_content: Since all sides of a square are equal, its area is found by multiplying one side by itself. For example, a square with side length six centimetres has an area of thirty-six square centimetres.
explanation: Squaring the side length calculates the area of a square.

title: Calculate the Area of a Rectangle
content: What is the area of a rectangle with length 7 cm and width 3 cm?
speech_to_text_content: What is the area of a rectangle with length seven centimetres and width three centimetres?

title: Explain the formula for area
content: Explain in your own words why the formula for the area of a rectangle is length × width.
speech_to_text_content: Explain in your own words why the formula for the area of a rectangle is length times width.

answer.answer_text: The formula length times width works because the rectangle is made up of rows and columns of squares. Multiplying length by width counts all the squares inside.

title: True or False
content: A square is a special type of rectangle where all sides are equal.
speech_to_text_content: True or false: A square is a special type of rectangle where all sides are equal.
explanation: By definition, a square has all sides equal and is a rectangle with equal length and width.

title: Fill in the Blank
content: The formula for the area of a rectangle is _____ × _____.
speech_to_text_content: Fill in the blanks: The formula for the area of a rectangle is length times width.
